page.title: 16HOUSING IN BETHERSDEN
page.content: THE AREA CONTAINS 390 DWELLINGS, 25% OF WHICH ARE STATE OWNED. 60% ARE IN THE VILLAGE NUCLEUS,AN AREA OF 300 ACRES. IN THE VILLAGE ARE FOUR MAIN ESTATES. THE REMAINDER OF THE HOMES ARE IN A RIBBON FORMATION ON THE MAIN ARTERIAL ROAD, OR ON COUNTRY LANES. THERE ARE SEVERAL HAMLETS AND FARMS SCATTERED THROUGHOUT.DIVERSITY OF DWELLINGS RANGES FROM SMALL 200 YEAR OLD FARM LABOURERS' COTTAGES UP TO 400 YEAR OLD YEOMAN HOUSES AND ONE LARGE HOUSE OF THE MANSION TYPE.THE ESTATES CONSIST MAINLY OF SEMI-DETACHED AIREY TYPE HOUSES AND OTHERS BUILT OF BRICK AND TILE.IN THE VILLAGE THERE ARE SEVERAL SEMI-DETACHED BUNGALOWS FOR THE ELDERLY.A LOCAL FIRM PRODUCES WOODEN HOUSES WITH A UNIQUE WOODEN TILE COVERING CALLED A SHINGLE.SOME OF THESE TYPE OF HOUSES CAN BE FOUND WITHIN THE VILLAGE.
